data.title: Yearly & Monthly weather
data.meta_description: London, Canada - Climate and weather forecast by month. Detailed climate information with charts - average monthly weather with temperature, pressure, humidity, precipitation, wind, daylight, sunshine, visibility, and UV index data. The month with the most snowfall in London, Canada, is January, when snow falls for 17.8 days and typically aggregates up to 71mm (2.8") of snow. Winter in London, from December through February, is marked by cold temperatures, increased snowfall, and reduced daylight hours.
data.text:
Average temperature

London, Canada

The warmest month (with the highest average high temperature) is July (25.5째C).

The month with the lowest average high temperature is January (-2.8째C).

The month with the highest average low temperature is July (15.4째C).

The coldest months (with the lowest average low temperature) are January and February (-8.2째C).

Average rainfall days

London, Canada

The month with the highest number of rainy days is May (14.1 days).

The months with the least rainy days are January and February (5.7 days).

Average snowfall days

London, Canada

The month with the highest number of snowfall days is January (17.8 days).

The months with the least snowfall days are June, July, August and September (0 days).

Average daylight / Average sunshine

London, Canada

The month with the longest days is June (Average daylight: 15h and 18min).

The month with the shortest days is December (Average daylight: 9h and 6min).

The month with the most sunshine is July (Average sunshine: 10h and 6min).

The month with the least sunshine is January (Average sunshine: 2h and 18min).

Average UV index

London, Canada

The months with the highest UV index are May, June, July and August (UV index 5).

The months with the lowest UV index are January, February and December (UV index 1).

Average visibility

London, Canada

The months with the highest visibility are March, April, May, June, July, August, September, October, November and December (9km).

The months with the lowest visibility are January and February (8km).
